intro: Anisophyllea obanica, commonly known as the Oban Island aniseleaf, is a flowering plant native to the island of Oban in the Philippines. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with alternating leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the genus Anisophyllea. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
